item.description:
I kid you not.This little gem "12:08 East of Bucharest " is a Romanian comedy, whose original title ,"A fost n-a fost?", translates literally as "Was there or wasn't there?". The question it seeks to answer is whether the inhabitants of a small town were part of the revolution before the fall of Communism in Romania in 1989

" Sixteen years after the revolution that freed Romania from Communist rule, there is still debate about whether it delivered all that was promised. The buoyant little comedy "12:08 East of Bucharest" puts its finger on the problem in the best tradition of East European humor, savvy but concrete, gentle but sharp as a knife. Corneliu Porumboiu's first feature adds another voice to the growing ranks of interesting new Romanian helmers in this low-key audience pleaser for small markets." Variety

The film also won two awards at that other film festival, Cannes.

Here is a review:

http://www.floatation...

After the movie, I will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row and then off to a local spot to discuss.
item.name: Winner Best Film at 2006 Transylvania Film Festival
